= Mconf =

Mconf is a project that aims to create a complete and easy to use webconference system, with focus on the interaction with mobile devices and social networks.

This wiki contains the technical documentation of Mconf. To learn more about the project, we recommend that you first read the content in our page: http://mconf.org

The source code for all projects that compose Mconf can be found at https://github.com/mconf/

  * For *feedbacks, suggestions and troubleshooting* (or anything else you need), [MconfFAQ see our FAQ] or contact us at our mailing list: `mconf-dev@googlegroups.com`
  * Found a *bug*? Please [http://code.google.com/p/mconf/issues/list create an issue].
  * Want to *collaborate*? Fork [https://github.com/mconf some of our repositories at github] and send a pull request!


The project is currently built on top of the open source system [http://www.bigbluebutton.org BigBlueButton].

== Contributors ==

Mconf is being developed at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS), in Porto Alegre, Brazil. Currently everyone involved in the project is a member of the [http://www.inf.ufrgs.br/prav/ PRAV] research group. The project is funded by [http://www.rnp.br/ RNP].

Check our team to see who's currently working on the project: http://mconf.org/m/about/team (or you can also see it in [https://github.com/mconf our github page] or [http://code.google.com/p/mconf/people/list here at gcode]).


== Mconf Webconference Network ==

Interested in the global webconference network? See this page for more information about it: http://mconf.org/m/about/network

== Documentation of our subprojects ==

  * [MconfMobile Mconf-Mobile]: Mconf-Mobile is an Android implementation of a webconference client.
  * [MconfWeb Mconf-Web]: Mconf-Web is the social network that provides access to webconferences..
  * [MconfLive Mconf-Live]: Here you can learn more about Mconf-Live, Mconf's webconference application.
